Sentencas: Variation of electrochemical performance of a La0.58Sr0.4Co0.2Fe0.8O3 (LSCF) cathode due to chromium gas-phase deposition has been studied at 800A degrees C.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: The highest degradation rate is observed under open circuit conditions and is related to formation of a SrCrO4 layer on the surface of an LSCF cathode.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: This results in an increase in both polarization and ohmic electrode resistance.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: The degradation rate is 3.7 and 0.5 Ohm cm(2)/1000
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium
Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: When external polarization is applied, the degradation rate decreases considerably.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: It is found that the amount of chromium in the cathode bulk changes nonlinearly at an increase in current density.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: At 0.2 A/cm(2), the overall amount of chromium is twice as large as under open circuit conditions, but the degradation rate is three times lower.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: Herewith, a considerable amount of chromium was found both on the cathode surface and in its bulk.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: The results of model experiments show that exposure to external electric current leads to migration of chromium cations in the bulk of the porous cathode.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: It is shown that the growth of a SrCrO4 layer on the surface of an LSCF cathode and penetration of chromium into the cathode bulk becomes slower at the current density of 0.5 A/cm(2).
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: Under similar conditions (temperature, current density, and time), the amount of chromium in an LSCF cathode is 2.5-7.3 times larger as compared to that in La0.65Sr0.3MnO3.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: However, the rate of degradation of electrochemical performance of an LSCF cathode is lower, which points to its higher tolerance towards the presence of chromium.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium

Sentencas: This is due to higher oxygenionic conductivity of an LSCF cathode.
Titulo: Effect of current density on poisoning rate of Co-containing fuel cell cathodes by chromium
